definition: to explain the facts/to defend against an accusation

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: But Riedel contends there are still plenty of opportunities ahead.
sentences.chinese: 但里德尔分辩说，中国还存在着大量的机会。

sentences.english: Maybe she would be crying and would push him away when he tried to explain to her.
sentences.chinese: 她也许还会哭着一把将他推开，不容他分辩。

sentences.english: I believe it is important to separate good failures from bad failures.
sentences.chinese: 我认为分辩精采的失踪败与欠好的失踪败很主要。

sentences.english: In addition, many resolution styles are provided.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还提供了许多分辩率样式。

sentences.english: Baiyuneboite-(Ce) was studied by electron diffraction and high resolution electron microscopy.
sentences.chinese: 用电子衍射和高分辩电子显微术研究了白云鄂博矿。

sentences.english: Examples include the display output and resolution.
sentences.chinese: 例如显示输出和分辩率。

sentences.english: Now you have to set the resolution by moving the big slider.
sentences.chinese: 现在您可以拖动较大的那个滚动条开设置分辩率了。

sentences.english: Its supporters have justified the space station as a terminal for the space shuttle.
sentences.chinese: 空间站的支持者曾分辩说它是航天飞机的终点站。

sentences.english: The variation of FWHM of resolution function with neutron energy is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了分辩函数半宽度随中子能量变化的规律。

sentences.english: Virtuous acyions of the past produce Viveka and Vairagya.
sentences.chinese: 过往的善行使人拥有分辩智与离欲心。

definition: to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
to shout at sb to stop
